metadata.synopsis: The taskmaster is another cruel duergar. He is whipping several pack animals to clear out some rubble, but his arm is tired and asks you to step in. You might discover they want the rubble cleared because a valuable forge can be found behind it. If you convince the beasts to break through, he attacks you because he doesn't want to share the wealth.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Speak to Herdmaster Skarjall - S_UND_FearfulRothe_Guard_001 (Position -668 13 442)Repro steps:1. Start the game2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. goto -657, 4434. Walk towards the Rothe area

0.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
0.text: You gonna cane 'em or what? Time those rothé got to work.
0.context: NodeContext: Hoon = outsider. Dorn = friend. Urop (YUR-op) - slave.

32.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
32.text: Well look here - Nere's killer in the flesh. Make yourself useful, grab a cane and whip these drugnin' beasts into shape.
32.context: NodeContext: Hoon = outsider. Dorn = friend. Urop (YUR-op) - slave.

58.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
58.text: That rubble needs clearing, and my patience is hanging on by an arse whisker.
58.context: NodeContext: DRUG-ning - 'fuckin' beasts back to work...'

15.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
15.text: Shouldn't be trouble for a brute like you.
15.context: NodeContext: DRUG-ning - 'fuckin' beasts back to work...'

112.speaker: Player
112.text: You want me to cane these poor beasts?
112.context: NodeContext: DRUG-ning - 'fuckin' beasts back to work...'

93.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
93.context: NodeContext: DRUG-ning - 'fuckin' beasts back to work...'

46.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
46.text: Gettin' cramps in my arm from trying to whip the drugnin' beasts back to work.
46.context: NodeContext: DRUG-ning - 'fuckin' beasts back to work...'

12.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
12.text: Now get to the canin', before I thrash you instead.

111.speaker: Player
111.text: Almost sounds like you're asking for help, if I ignore your tone.

107.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
107.text: And it sounds like your arse wants for a lashing, the way you talk out of it.

81.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
81.text: Don't think I won't thrash you harder than the rothé.

120.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
120.text: Something's spooked the dumbshits. So stop your jawin', and get to workin'.
120.context: NodeContext: Disdainful. A heavy-handed duergar foreman's been mistreating his beasts of burden.

14.speaker: Player
14.context: NodeContext: Disdainful. A heavy-handed duergar foreman's been mistreating his beasts of burden.

132.speaker: Player
132.text: I know these creatures well. You should give them another lash of the cane.
132.context: NodeContext: Disdainful. A heavy-handed duergar foreman's been mistreating his beasts of burden.

69.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
69.text: You got your orders. I'm not taking one more whack.
69.context: NodeContext: Disdainful. A heavy-handed duergar foreman's been mistreating his beasts of burden.

67.speaker: Player
67.text: Watch it - take the cane to those beasts again and this standoff turns to slaughter.
67.context: NodeContext: Disdainful. A heavy-handed duergar foreman's been mistreating his beasts of burden.

31.speaker: Lae'zel
31.text: Watch it - take the cane to those beasts again and this standoff turns to slaughter.
31.context: NodeContext: Disdainful. A heavy-handed duergar foreman's been mistreating his beasts of burden.

139.speaker: Shadowheart
139.text: Fool. He should've used the threat of the cane over the cane itself. Now those beasts are ready to charge.
139.context: NodeContext: Disdainful. A heavy-handed duergar foreman's been mistreating his beasts of burden.

79.speaker: Karlach
79.text: If he winds up, I'm gonna snap his neck - if the rothé don't stomp his lights out first.
79.context: CinematicNodeContext: Skarjall cracks the cane at the rothe with his last NggghHA!NodeContext: Cracks a whip at his beast of burden.

84.speaker: Astarion
84.text: Just as well, perhaps. Beat anything for long enough and it'll snap.
84.context: CinematicNodeContext: Skarjall cracks the cane at the rothe with his last NggghHA!NodeContext: Cracks a whip at his beast of burden.

16.speaker: Wyll
16.text: Hold your tongue. Those rothé are ready to blow - and you'll be lighting the fuse.
16.context: CinematicNodeContext: Skarjall cracks the cane at the rothe with his last NggghHA!NodeContext: Cracks a whip at his beast of burden.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: Please. Are you so feeble you can't deliver a single lash?
51.context: CinematicNodeContext: Skarjall cracks the cane at the rothe with his last NggghHA!NodeContext: Cracks a whip at his beast of burden.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: Please. Are you so feeble you can't deliver a single lash?
49.context: CinematicNodeContext: Skarjall cracks the cane at the rothe with his last NggghHA!NodeContext: Cracks a whip at his beast of burden.

119.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
119.text: Shit. You calling me weak, jargh?
119.context: CinematicNodeContext: Skarjall cracks the cane at the rothe with his last NggghHA!NodeContext: Cracks a whip at his beast of burden.

3.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Skarjall cracks the cane at the rothe with his last NggghHA!NodeContext: Cracks a whip at his beast of burden.

4.text: Gh'rack - you knew I'd rile them up. I'll split you from head to hole for this!
4.context: CinematicNodeContext: The duergar canes the rothe and they go into a frenzy, ready to attack everyone near.

2.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
2.text: Gh'rack - you knew I'd rile them up. I'll split you from head to hole for this!
2.context: NodeContext: GRACK! (Damn it!) Angry and aggressive.

34.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
34.text: You got no need to know, and I got no need to tell. So get to caning, or to leaving.

89.speaker: Narrator
89.text: *Your eye finds the source of the gleam: a small mote of black metal. Adamantine.*

7.speaker: Narrator
7.text: *Your eye finds the source of the gleam: a small mote of black metal. Adamantine.*

1.speaker: Narrator
1.text: *You remember blacksmiths speaking of it in hushed awe - the hardest substance known to exist, used for the finest weapons and armour.*

21.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
21.text: I saw it too - adamantine. The forge is behind the rubble. And the duergar mean to lay claim to it.
21.context:
CinematicNodeContext: TASKMASTER SKARJALL sighs, pulls a rock of admanatine from his rear pocket,  and holds it out. About the size and shape of a small rock. He then puts it back in his pocket.

NodeContext: Sighs before line

30.speaker: Lae'zel
30.text: I saw it too - adamantine. The forge is behind the rubble. And the duergar mean to lay claim to it.
30.context:
CinematicNodeContext: TASKMASTER SKARJALL sighs, pulls a rock of admanatine from his rear pocket,  and holds it out. About the size and shape of a small rock. He then puts it back in his pocket.

NodeContext: Sighs before line

98.speaker: Shadowheart
98.text: Adamantine. We must be nearing the forge.
98.context:
CinematicNodeContext: TASKMASTER SKARJALL sighs, pulls a rock of admanatine from his rear pocket,  and holds it out. About the size and shape of a small rock. He then puts it back in his pocket.

NodeContext: Sighs before line

29.speaker: Karlach
29.text: Adamantine. Bet we're near the forge. Wonder if I could melt that stuff...
29.context:
CinematicNodeContext: TASKMASTER SKARJALL sighs, pulls a rock of admanatine from his rear pocket,  and holds it out. About the size and shape of a small rock. He then puts it back in his pocket.

NodeContext: Sighs before line

86.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
86.text: You want to access the forge, is that it? I've already been there.
86.context:
CinematicNodeContext: TASKMASTER SKARJALL sighs, pulls a rock of admanatine from his rear pocket,  and holds it out. About the size and shape of a small rock. He then puts it back in his pocket.

NodeContext: Sighs before line

68.speaker: Player
68.text: You want to access the forge, is that it? I've already been there.
68.context:
CinematicNodeContext: TASKMASTER SKARJALL sighs, pulls a rock of admanatine from his rear pocket,  and holds it out. About the size and shape of a small rock. He then puts it back in his pocket.

NodeContext: Sighs before line

70.speaker: Player
70.text: I know what you're after. There's adamantine back there, isn't there?
70.context:
CinematicNodeContext: TASKMASTER SKARJALL sighs, pulls a rock of admanatine from his rear pocket,  and holds it out. About the size and shape of a small rock. He then puts it back in his pocket.

NodeContext: Sighs before line

88.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
88.text: Stuff's no joke. Stronger than steel, rarer than mithral. It ain't mined - it's made.
88.context:
CinematicNodeContext: TASKMASTER SKARJALL sighs, pulls a rock of admanatine from his rear pocket,  and holds it out. About the size and shape of a small rock. He then puts it back in his pocket.

NodeContext: Sighs before line

5.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
5.text: There's an adamantine forge back there, sure as shittin'.

52.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
52.text: Don't get any smart ideas - that forge is clan property. But get the beasts moving and I'll toss some coin your way.

117.speaker: Player
117.text: You can't keep me from the forge - I've already found it.

50.speaker: Player
50.text: Let's see what I can do.

103.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
103.text: Go on, then - light a fire under the buggers.

125.speaker: Player
125.text: Sounds like your problem. Figure it out yourself.

60.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
60.text: Drugh. Should'a told you to piss off when I had the chance.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: Thanks for the tip. Once you're dead, I'll have that forge to myself.

24.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
24.text: Drugnin' hoon. I'll split you from head to hole!

90.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
90.text: Just splittin' then? Suit your damn self.

72.speaker: Player
72.text: Out of my way. I'll take care of the rothé.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: You're after adamantine? That stuff's too fine for your lot. Best you stick to scrap iron.

73.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
73.text: Just because we don't waste time prettifying things doesn't mean we can't make use of good ore.

121.speaker: Astarion
121.text: Well would you look at that. The forge can't be far now.
121.context: NodeContext: Notices a glittering spot of precious metal

64.speaker: Wyll
64.text: Adamantine. That forge must be within spitting distance.

109.speaker: Gale
109.text: You saw it too? The fabled adamantine forge is around the bend. We just have a few snags to untangle.

82.text: *The glint fades before your eye finds its source.*

116.speaker: Narrator
116.text: *The glint fades before your eye finds its source.*

123.speaker: Player
123.text: You want my help? Then you will tell me what's back there.

48.speaker: Player
48.text: You want my help? Then you will tell me what's back there.

23.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
23.text: Adamantine. Stuff's no joke. Stronger than steel, rarer than mithral. It ain't mined - it's made.
23.context: CinematicNodeContext: TASKMASTER SKARJALL pulls a small rock of admanatine from his rear pocket and holds it out. He then puts it back in his pocket.

26.text: Shit. Sooner give a lurker a lickjob.

13.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
13.text: Shit. Sooner give a lurker a lickjob.

126.speaker: Player
126.text: Examine the rubble for anything unusual.
126.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player tries to mindmeld with the taskmaster but fails.

129.text: *You see only the most mundane of rocks and minerals.*

124.speaker: Narrator
124.text: *You see only the most mundane of rocks and minerals.*

113.speaker: Player
113.text: Call on the parasite, connect with the taskmaster. What does he seek?
113.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player tries to mindmeld with the taskmaster but fails.

134.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
134.text: You're one of Nere's, eh? Don't go bursting those head-veins - I ain't joined your bat-brained cult.
134.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player tries to mindmeld with the taskmaster but fails.

63.speaker: Player
63.text: Leave it to me. I'll show these deep rothé who's in charge.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: Rest your arm. I'll put these beasts to work.

39.speaker: Gale
39.text: Another lick of the cane and those rothés are going on a rampage.

53.speaker: Player
53.text: You want to thrash me? Go on, then.

43.speaker: Player
43.text: Best if you stop whinging and get those whiskers trimmed.

141.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
141.text: Volunteering, are you? Well we ain't getting paid to flirt. Might not get paid at all, with this mess.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: A brute? Is that what you see?

118.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
118.text: Sure as shittin'. That orc blood makes you damn near feral.

80.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
80.text: There's no denying the blood-call. And there's no shame in it. Now go on, brute, and get these beasts moving.

75.speaker: Player
75.text: A brute? Is that what you see?

100.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
100.text: Sure as shittin'. One look from you'd send half this place runnin'. Bloody handy, that.

28.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
28.text: Sure as shittin' you could deal with some stubborn rothe. Go on, get 'em moving.

114.speaker: Player
114.text: Perhaps you should just try asking them instead.

45.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
45.text: Oh aye, maybe say pretty please as well? Throw in a curtsy? Don't be soft.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: Show the animals some respect. Then you may get results.

27.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
27.text: Think if you respect a turd it'll smell any sweeter? Waste of bloody time.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: A duergar asking a dwarf for help? Never thought I'd see the day.

130.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
130.text: Keep this between us or you'll never see another day - got it?

74.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
74.text: Let 'em clear the rubble. Then you'll get what's coming to you.
74.context: CinematicNodeContext: Skarjall takes out his weapon and enters combat stance.

77.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
77.text: Not enough caning for my tastes, but you got the job done.
77.context: CinematicNodeContext: Skarjall takes out his weapon and enters combat stance.

6.text: I almost feel bad about this.
6.context: CinematicNodeContext: Skarjall takes out his weapon and enters combat stance.

108.text: I almost feel bad about this.
108.context: CinematicNodeContext: Evil smile - snarling voice.NodeContext: Evil smile - snarling voice.

66.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
66.text: I almost feel bad about this.
66.context: CinematicNodeContext: Evil smile - snarling voice.NodeContext: Evil smile - snarling voice.

78.speaker: Player
78.text: What in the hells? I helped you, and now you want me dead?

17.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
17.text: Adamantine is precious, jargh. And I'm not the sharing type.

137.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
137.text: There's an adamantine forge back there, jargh. And I'm not the sharing type.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: You'll be feeling even worse in a moment.

87.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
87.text: How about you stop making messes? Grab a cane and whip these beasts into shape.
87.context: NodeContext: Hoon = outsider. Dorn = friend. Urop (YUR-op) - slave.

92.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
92.context: NodeContext: Hoon = outsider. Dorn = friend. Urop (YUR-op) - slave.

95.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
95.text: You - grab a cane and whip these drugnin' beasts into shape.
95.context: NodeContext: Hoon = outsider. Dorn = friend. Urop (YUR-op) - slave.

97.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
97.text: Grab a cane and get these rothé moving!

101.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
101.text: Get to caning or to leaving, hoon.

104.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
104.text: Well lookie there - and not one crack of the cane.

94.speaker: Player
94.text: What in the hells are you turning on me for?

110.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
110.text: Just you wait for what happens next.

122.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
122.text: If you ain't helping, piss off.
